title: 105_s2545
content: The Act titled "Medicare HMO Protection Act of 1998" authorizes the evaluation and alteration of termination decisions. Section 1851(g)(3) of the Social Security Act is amended to allow the Secretary to delay the termination of a Medicare+Choice plan if it poses a serious health risk to enrollees or significantly reduces available plans. The Secretary can delay the termination of a Medicare+Choice plan if it results in a significant reduction in available plans in the affected area or if the organization offers plans in nearby areas without suffering financial losses. The Secretary has the authority to audit and inspect the organization's books or records to make this determination. The Secretary can delay termination of a Medicare+Choice plan if it leads to a significant reduction in available plans or if the organization offers plans in nearby areas without financial losses. The Secretary has the authority to inspect the organization's books or records under section 1857(d). If an adequate provider network is established, the Secretary can end the delay before the established period. The Medicare+Choice organization can negotiate a new contract with the Secretary if termination is delayed, ensuring beneficiaries are not adversely affected. SEC. 3. Extension of initial Medicare+Choice contract period to 3 years. Amends the Social Security Act to require contracts to have a term of at least 3 years. Effective for contracts entered into after the enactment of this Act. SEC. 4. Notice of termination. The amendment to the Social Security Act requires Medicare organizations to provide written notice 120 days before contract termination, including information on alternative benefit options. The amendment to the Social Security Act mandates Medicare organizations to give 120 days written notice before terminating a contract, including details on available Medicare+Choice plans, Medicare supplemental policies, costs, and local social service agencies for assistance. Effective for termination notices issued after the enactment of this Act.
